skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: This official skill provides writing guidance and examples only. It contains no executable code, external calls, or data handling logic.

content.user_title: Draft internal communications with clear formats
content.value_statement: Internal updates often vary in tone and structure across teams. This skill gives ready formats for 3P updates, newsletters, FAQs, and general notices.
actual_capabilities: Format 3P updates with Progress, Plans, Problems sections and strict line order
Draft company newsletters with section headers and short bullet points
Create FAQ items with Question and Answer pairs
Guide general internal messages by asking for audience, purpose, tone, and format
Emphasize concise, company wide relevance in newsletters
limitations: Needs user provided facts, metrics, and links to draft content
Does not fetch data from Slack, email, or documents
Only covers formats defined in the included examples
Does not provide incident report templates beyond general guidance

use_cases.title: Weekly 3P update
use_cases.description: Produce a concise Progress, Plans, Problems update for leadership review.

use_cases.title: Company newsletter
use_cases.description: Compile a weekly newsletter with sections, links, and highlights for all staff.

use_cases.title: Company FAQ roundup
use_cases.description: Summarize common employee questions with clear, official answers.

prompt_templates.title: Basic 3P update
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a short weekly team update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Mobile team for last week. Progress: shipped login fix. Plans: release new onboarding. Problems: QA bandwidth.

prompt_templates.title: Newsletter summary
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a company wide newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a company newsletter for last week. Include announcements, priority progress, leadership updates, and social updates. Use short bullets.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ set
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a weekly FAQ list
prompt_templates.prompt: Create five FAQ items from these topics: new executive hire, hiring plan, product launch date, office policy change, fundraising update.

prompt_templates.title: Custom internal memo
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a tailored internal message
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask me the key questions you need, then draft a concise internal message about a new remote work policy.

output_examples.input: Write a 3P update for the Data team for last week.
output: Progress: Shipped the metrics dashboard refresh and reduced query latency by 18 percent.
Plans: Roll out anomaly alerts and finalize the data catalog migration plan.
Problems: Two open analyst roles are slowing onboarding of new datasets.

best_practices: Confirm the communication type and time period before drafting
Use short sentences and include links when provided
State uncertainty clearly and cite official sources
anti_patterns: Mixing newsletter and 3P formats in one draft
Including team specific details in company wide updates
Writing without confirming audience, scope, or time frame

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text guidance skill that works in any of those tools.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only covers the formats in the examples and relies on your input.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack or email data?
faq.answer: Only if you provide access or paste the relevant content.

faq.question: Does it store or transmit company data?
faq.answer: No. It contains no data handling or network code.

faq.question: What should I do if the output is too generic?
faq.answer: Provide specific facts, metrics, links, and the intended audience.

faq.question: How does it compare to a general writing assistant?
faq.answer: It enforces company style formats like 3P updates, newsletters, and FAQs.
